resources.string: Clear Dryads in the Crescent Window, and clear Blight Fiends at the Blisteroot. Then report back to Survivalist Ellwood in Edengrove.

Yes, that’s the question on everyone’s minds, isn’t it? Edengrove is a place of vast natural magic, the Angry Earth’s ancient home. \n\nIf the Blight can spread this fast, even here, maybe nothing can stop it.
Ah, well, there are many theories, but I prefer facts. Will you help me find some? \n\nI need samples from both the Dryads and the Blight Fiends. That will at least be a start.
The Angry Earth Dryads are deadly enough already, but the Blight makes them even worse.\n\nPlease, try to come back in one piece.

Ah, thank you, these will do nicely. \n\nIt feels odd, trying to help the Angry Earth. My old instructor would have told me off for sympathizing with the enemy, instead of taking advantage of their weakness.
"Why do you fight the Angry Earth?"

Survival, brave one. Living humans have always been the most endangered species on Aeternum. \n\nPersonally, I’d like to try and find a way to live in harmony with nature. But the Angry Earth are…angry.
Clear the road along the Crescent Window of Dryads
Craft or procure a Concentrated Blight Tincture, and then report back to Survivalist Ellwood in Edengrove.
I thought so too. Some of the Dryads seemed amiable, but after the Blight emerged, communication broke down.\n\n If we purge the Blight from the Grove, they might come around… I hope.
I'll study these samples you've recovered. In the meantime, you should learn how to protect yourself against the Blight's effects.\n\nUse this recipe to craft a protective tincture, and then return.
If you do not have the resources to craft a Blight Tincture, you'll have to gather or purchase them from the Trading Post.
Ah, yes. Well done! This can save you from great suffering.\n\nMore than a few have limped into the outpost covered in red fungus. They beg for death even as it saps away their strength.

We grant their wish. What else can we do? They die, and don't seem to resurrect.\n\nI fear their true fate may be darker than death, but let's not speak of such things. Just… use the tincture wisely, brave one.
Defeat Denman at the top of Nettlevex tower, and bring his remains to Ellwood in Edengrove.

There is a tower known as Nettlevex. The tower itself has become Blighted, but some within have resisted. \n\nThere's one in particular known as the "Denman." Bring me samples of its vines if you can.
The tower is a rough gauntlet, and the Dryads are formidable. \n\nTake care in your climb, Denman will be the strongest of the lot.
Ah, indeed, a fine specimen. The wood and earth that compose Denman's vines flow thick with old azoth.\n\nThis supports my theory. Did you know Edengrove is the source of all Angry Earth on Aeternum?

Yes, it's their home. I theorize that newborn Angry Earth creatures are more susceptible to Blight.\n\nOlder creatures like the Denman are better able to resist, but without more data, a theory is just a theory…
Defeat Denman atop the tower of {POITags}
Go to the ruins of Litheltop and investigate the hidden Blight at its heart. Then report back to Survivalist Ellwood in Edengrove.
I'm not sure yet. There's a fresh outbreak of Blight deep in Elysian Falls, at Litheltop.\n\nThe Dryads there are old and experienced, and they may be able to resist it… for now.

Yes, and be wary - even if they are not Blighted, the Dryads will consider you a foe. \n\nBut a fresh outbreak means fresh Blight samples. The fresher the sample, the more it may reveal about its origins.
We aren't the Dryads' true enemy, but they don't make that distinction. \n\nYou will undoubtedly have to fight them when you go to collect those Blight samples.
So the Dryads at Litheltop have held out so far? That's good. Supports my theory.\n\nLet’s see these fresh Blight samples then… hmmm. Oh. This one is old growth, and yet still infected…
It certainly contradicts it. If it’s not the age of the Earth specimen that determines its vulnerability to Blight, then what? \n\nI…I must think on this.
Defeat the Blight Fiends for a sample of Blight
Sabotage the Corrupted miners in the Profane Seam by raiding their supplies and thinning their numbers. Then report back to Warden Ducquet in Edengrove.
We've been waiting for the right opportunity, of course. Like your arrival.\n\nThis would seem to be the right moment, if you're willing to lead the charge.
Perfect. The Corrupted have been setting mine-camps in the Profane Seam.\n\nStrike their positions there, disarm them if you can, and we'll soon know their strength.
Have you been to the Profane Seam yet? The fiends think that hiding among the crags will keep them safe. \n\nThey'll soon know better, won't they?

Success! You're quite the warrior, aren't you? Assaulting their camps and striking without mercy. Well done! \n\nPerhaps that will slow their supply chain from Great Cleave and Shattered Mountain, as well.
Sabotage Corrupted miners in the Profane Seam
Defeat the {targetName} in the Profane Seam
Loot {itemName}s from chests in the Profane Seam
Gutting the Guard, Firing the Foreman
Destroy Elite Guard Philippe and Foreman Harold in the mines in the Profane Seam. Then report back to Warden Ducquet in Edengrove.
"That sounds like a plan to me."
Perfect. The Rangers have identified the commanders.\n\nElite Guard Philippe and Foreman Robertson - destroy that pair, and we'll have all the Corrupted in Edengrove running scared.
The Rangers say Philippe and Robertson are running operations from within the mine. Good luck, Warden.
Cut off the head and the body will fall! Dealing with those two will bring their operations to a standstill. \n\nThat should have the Corrupted questioning their strategy here.
Speak to Legatus Fulvius in Reekwater.

You will? Excellent. Although, It is a bit of a trek. But! If you're sure...\n\nThis message is for the local Magistrate, Legatus Fulvius. He will have need of your talents beyond the lightness of your feet. Of that, I am certain.
Just head south for… ages, really. Make sure you have plenty of rations for the journey.

What's this, then? A message all the way from Edengrove? I don't know many who could make that trek in one piece. Consider me impressed.\n\nSince you're here, I believe I can make use of a hardy traveler like yourself.
Investigate the Ancient Guardians and their movements in the Primal Lochan. Then report back to Ranger Wardell in Edengrove.
Well, in most territories, they are charged with simply securing certain ruins.\n\nHere, however, it seems they are charged with securing all of Edengrove.
Oh, yes. We Rangers have been fighting them back for years. \n\nI fear with all the attention on the Corrupted and the Blight, we've let them regain their strength.
Yes, the Guardians typically launch their attacks from a place called the Primal Lochan.\n\nIf your offer is sincere, then attack them there and weaken their forces.
It seems there was a time when the Ancients considered this territory to be exclusively theirs.\n\nThe Guardians still seem dead-set on enforcing this mandate.
Ah, there you are. I hope you dealt them a blow from which they won't soon recover.\n\nThe last thing we need right now is to fall under attack from the Ancient Guardians.

Back to their patrol, then. Funny, isn't it? That my duty is the same as theirs.\n\nWill I also someday lose all but bone to my duty? I suppose such philosophical questions are pointless, when the duty remains.
Repel the Ancient Guardian threat at {POITags}
Collect Wyrdwood Tears from the Dryad soldiers in the Wyrdwood Twists area. Then report back to Ranger Wardell in Edengrove.
I do, so listen well. Edengrove is abundant in wyrdwood trees, which have a beautiful glow. \n\nThe sap from such trees can be refined into what we call Wyrdwood Tears - sacred to the Rangers.
The Tears benefit one's health, but in truth, we do not refine them ourselves.\n\nOur secret is that we earn them by battling the Dryads of the Wyrdwood Twists. Gather some and I will reward you.
Collecting the Tears will support the Rangers out in the wilds. \n\nYou're doing us a significant favor here.
Ah, these Tears have saved my life more than once, when I was alone in the wilds.\n\nThese will be much appreciated by the other Rangers, as well. We are, again, in your debt.
We are whispers in the forest, eyes in shadows... You may not see us, but we will still be watching your back.\n\nI hope you'll come to appreciate our help as we've come to appreciate yours.
Collect Wyrdwood Tears from the Dryads of {POITags}
Meet Survivalist Ellwood in Edengrove's northeast Outpost.
He was in quite a hurry. His mission to combat the Blight drew him to the northeast Outpost.\n\nHe asked if you would meet him there. I told him I would relay the message, and so I have.
The journey northeast will be a difficult one. That I can assure you.
Ah, brave one, I see you have made the journey safely. I am glad to see your face.\n\nForgive my rush, but I believe that here in the northeast, we will find the answers we seek.
Go to the Blightcrown to investigate the movement of the Blight beyond Edengrove.
Yes, that’s my theory! \n\nBlight is apparently a threat to all life forms, but what if that’s the entire point? What if it's actually a mechanism of self-defense?
Exactly. We know it's infected Edengrove, but where else has it spread? \n\nShattered Mountain, I suspect. If you're willing, visit the Blightcrown and Preservation Pass to make sure.
Beyond the Pass is the the Shattered Mountain, where I'm told the Corrupted have amassed in great numbers. \n\nIf you go there, go prepared.
Then you've confirmed it, have you? The Blight extends towards the Shattered Mountain.\n\nThe final question remains only, how is the Blight affecting the Corrupted?
"There were no Corrupted to be seen."
Aha! Just as I suspected! It’s as much a threat to the Corrupted as it is to rest of us.\n\nThe Blight is an attempt by Aeternum itself to fight against the Corruption.

Yes, exactly. It must be a last-ditch effort by the land to purge itself of Corruption’s poison. \n\nBut this cure will also kill every living thing in Aeternum. We need to remove the poison ourselves before that happens.
Investigate the presence of Blight at {POITags}
Watcher Lin has asked you to find a key to enter Zygoramet's Grove and destroy the dangerous creature inside. Then report back to Watcher Lin in Edengrove.

There was a naturalist here a few decades ago who disappeared after falling to the Blight.\n\nShe had discovered that there is an Angry Earth specimen here capable of replicating itself an infinite number of times... in the blink of an eye!

Yes. As soon as the Corruption abates, this creature will clone itself until it's taken over all of Aeternum.\n\nThe creature abides in Zygoramet's Grove to the south. Search the ruins near there for a key, then enter the cleft and destroy it. Please... you must believe me.
I am not exaggerating. The creature inside Zygoramet's Grove will consume us all.\n\nYou must get a key to enter the Grove and destroy it.
You've returned? The creature is slain then? Damn, you're the first who's actually believed me.\n\nPeople might not realize it, but we're all a lot safer now.
Not at all, in fact, I suspect that it will, given everything the naturalist said.\n\nIf the vile creature returns, however, we must be prepared to destroy it again. As many times as it takes.
Search the ruins of {POITags} for a key to enter Zygoramet's Grove
Defeat the Greenskeeper in the Garden of Genesis. Then report back to Survivalist Wardell in Edengrove.
Yes, it is the sacred nursery for all Angry Earth, and when young, they are most vulnerable.\n\nIf we help protect their young in the Garden, we may yet forge some understanding.
The Garden is threatened by the Blight and a being known as the Greenskeeper.\n\nDefeat the Greenskeeper to protect the young flora and hopefully restore the Garden to its natural state.
The Greenskeeper is not only a threat to the Garden, but to all of Aeternum. \n\nHe is but one of the many ways the Blight has manifested. We must release the Garden from his grip.

Ah! Then the Greensman is no more? His scourge will take ages to heal, but at least it has begun.\n\nThanks to you, brave one, there is hope. The young will sprout again, and cycle of the earth will continue.
A cycle bigger than any of us, no matter how long we live. \n\nWe've played our parts in restoring the Garden, and the island can now begin the healing process. I'm proud of you, brave one.
Venture to {POITags} and slay Dryads for Azoth-Infused Resin
Travel to {POITags} and claim a Golden Flintlock from the undead
Acquire a Precision-Engineered Barrel from Myrkgard Corrupted in {POITags}
Travel to {POITags} and defeat Southguard Corrupted for a Ramrod
Search Skullworm Pirates in {POITags} for a Hair Trigger
Acquire Seakissed Wood from Eridanite Dryads in {POITags}
Take a Shock-Absorbent Base from the Corrupted of {POITags}
Venture to {POITags} to claim materials for your weapon's stock
Complete Quest: Azoth is the Glue
Complete Quest: Heavy Is the Base
Complete Quest: Take Stock of the Heart
Collect the pieces to Clamorous Vox for Ranger Madaki to assemble.
Gather Azoth-Infused Resin from Angry Earth in Nettlevex.
Gather Golden Flintlock from Lost in Periville.
Gather Precision-Engineered Barrel from Corrupted in Greater Tribulation.
Gather Ramrod from Corrupted in Svikin's Stand.
Gather Hair Trigger from Undead in Stone Skull Fort.
Gather Seakissed Wood from Angry Earth in Eridanus.
Gather Shock-Absorbent Base from Corrupted in Scorpius.
Gather Impossibly Sturdy Vines from Angry Earth in Malevolence.
Gather the materials necessary to create Torrent, the legendary bow.
Travel to Periville and collect pieces of Pallid Ash Wood from the Undead.
Travel to the Spilaio Cavern and collect fragments of Bewitched Bone from Ancient Guardians.
Travel to the Stone Skull Fort and collect pieces of Seakissed Oak Wood from Pirates.
Climb the tallest tower in Edengrove, Malevolence, and collect Perfected Hemp String from Alcazarian Archers.
Brave Scorpius in Mourningdale and collect a piece of Codex-binding Leather from S'ylanx.
Travel to the Scorched Mines and collect Scorchvein Oil from Corrupted mineworkers.
Travel to the Mangled Heights and collect pieces of Blackened Sinew from Unhallowed Tendrils.
Travel to Eridanus and collect pieces of Enchanted Azoth Wood from Eridanite Yeoman.
Yes, well, if you have sharp eyes, and indeed, you must, if you spotted me here. \n\nThis bow is the mighty Torrent, a bow of legend among the rangers. Acquire these items and it shall be yours.
The Torrent would be the envy of any archer in Aeternum.\n\nA weapon without equal, I think.

You've got it all, eh? Otherworldly sinew, ancient bone, an oil coat, and a perfect string for a perfected draw. \n\nTake this bow, the Torrent, and wield it with pride. It's in a class all of its own.
Collect pieces of Pallid Ash Wood from {POITags}
Collect pieces of Pallid Ash Wood from Open Caskets
Travel to the Spilaio Cavern and slay Ancient Guardians for fragments of Bewitched Bone
Collect fragments of Bewitched Bone from Ancient Guardians
Obtain Seakissed Oak Wood from the pirates of Stone Skull Fort
Collect pieces of Seakissed Oak Wood from Skullworm Pirates
Climb the tower called Malevolence and obtain Perfected Hemp String from its archers
Collect Perfected Hemp String from Alcazarian Archers
Defeat S'ylanx in Scorpius for Codex-binding Leather
Travel to the Scorched Mines in search of Scorchvein Oil
Collect Scorchvein Oil from Corrupted mineworkers
Claim Blackened Sinew from Unhallowed Tendrils in the Mangled Heights
Collect a piece of Blackened Sinew from an Unhallowed Tendril
Travel to Eridanus and collect pieces of Enchanted Azoth Wood
Collect pieces of Enchanted Azoth Wood from Eridanite Yeoman
There's no better feeling than a musket in your hands, the power of fire, steel, and science.\n\nThere might even be an opportunity to craft a wholly unique firearm, if you're interested.
I've been calling this design the "Clamorous Vox", for how loud its gunfire will be.\n\nBring Ranger Madaki the parts and we'll be able to make you a musket beyond compare.
Madaki has the designs. You need only supply the parts.
You've acquired the parts for the Clamorous Vox. \n\nVery well, then you shall have it. A finer musket , the world has never known. Wield it well.
Recover the components needed to create the Greataxe called Reformation, then deliver them to Ranger Madaki in Mountainhome.

I do. The Corrupted call this design 'the Reformation', and though I despise them, I like the name.\n\nGather the components on this list and bring them to Madaki. Then the Reformation will be yours to wield.
Have you ever noticed how the Corrupted smell? \n\nIt's like some kind of sulfuric body odor mixed with spoiled fruit. Dreadful.
Here we are, you've acquired the components for the Greataxe. \n\nWell done, this is an axe destined to fell many Corrupted. Wield it with savage fury, {playerName}. Give them something to fear.
Infiltrate Myrkgard and acquire Corrupted Axe Heads
Acquire {itemName}s from Elite Myrkgard Axemen throughout Myrkgard
Acquire Corrupted Axe Heads from the Elite Myrkgard Axemen throughout Myrkgard
Ascend into the {POITags} in search of Corrupted Fangs
Collect {itemName}s from {targetName}s throughout the Mangled Heights
Obtain Corrupted Fangs from the Elite Corruption Swarmers in Mangled Heights
Hunt the Blighted within the tower {POITags}
Collect Blighted Growths from Blighted Dryads lurking in Malevolence in Edengrove.
Eliminate the Monstrous Corrupted gathered near Corruption Breaches
Locate Corruption Breaches throughout Aeternum, and cut down the hordes of Monstrous Corrupted who gather there
Collect Guardian Rib Bones from Ancient Guardians within {POITags}
In Cutlass Keys, retrieve Guardian Rib Bones from Ancient Guardians standing watch over Malocchio.
Assault Scorpius for Ancient Silver Bands
In Mourningdale, obtain Ancient Silver Bands from chests within Scorpius.
Gather {itemName}es from Ironwood Trees throughout Aeternum
Retrieve the Abandoned Vessels from containers throughout Spilaio Cavern.
Defeat Eridanite Dryads in {POITags} for Leather Wrappings
Obtain Fine Leather Wrappings from the Dryads of Eridanus.
Gather components to create the legendary tower shield Rook's Defense.
The classical opening and setting of the board from the Indian game Chatur that would later inspire Chess. Your opening lies in Malevolence.
In this deadly game of Chess, the ivory pieces move first. Your first move is to Scorpius.
The ability of the Pawn to dash forward to the front lines in its first play is a formidable move. Your next move takes you to Eridanus.
The Persian story of Shahnameh, the reenacting of an epic battle on a Chess board. Your battle continues in Periville.
Once a piece has been touched on the Chess board it must be moved. Your next move takes you to Stone Skull Fort.
Should a Pawn make it to the other side of the board alive it will be crowned a Queen. Your crowning comes in Caminus.
Castling is a move in Chess wherein the King moves two squares towards a Rook, and then the Rook moves to protect their King’s flank. Castle yourself in Mangled Heights.
An announcement that the other player's King has been placed in a position of peril. Check the Corrupted of Opulence.
I do. Using a shield, and one like this in particular, requires a strategy all of its own.\n\nIt's like a game I once played called 'Chess'; this shield is like the Rook to defend your King.
Find these components and bring them to Madaki. She is the master of the Forge, of course.\n\nWith these elements, she'll be able to grant you the 'Rook's Defense'.
There is no shield I have ever seen as formidable as the Rook's Defense will be.\n\nAssuming you follow through and get Madaki to forge it, that is.
A masterful game you've played, acquiring these components.\n\n You've earned Rook's Defense, and will doubtlessly wield it with the same impressive valor. Checkmate, indeed.
Seek an Ensouled Wooden Base from the Dryads of Malevolence
Venture to Scorpius and slay S'ylanx the Unseen for Corrupted Great Sword Shards
Acquire Glowing Plant Cores from the Dryads of Eridanus
Travel to Periville and collect Rotting Leather Straps
Loot Iron Plating from the Undead of Stone Skull Fort
Venture to Caminus and acquire Twisted Heraldry from Overseer Levy
Claim Corrupted Shield Lining from High Priest Oseguera at the Mangled Heights
Travel to Opulence and loot Orichalcum Studs from the Corrupted
